name: Set Theory & Quantifiers
description: Exploring the logical foundations of sets, relations, and formal quantifiers.

cards.title: Set Operations & Venn Diagrams
cards.description: Understanding fundamental set operations and their relationships.
bulletpoints: Learn union \( A \cup B = \{ x \mid x \in A \text{ or } x \in B \} \), intersection \( A \cap B = \{ x \mid x \in A \text{ and } x \in B \} \), and complement \( A^c = \{ x \mid x \notin A \} \).
Visualize relationships using Venn diagrams to represent overlapping sets.
Apply De Morgan’s laws: \[ (A \cup B)^c = A^c \cap B^c, \quad (A \cap B)^c = A^c \cup B^c \].

cards.title: Predicate Logic & Logical Quantifiers
cards.description: Exploring the role of quantifiers in mathematical statements.
bulletpoints: Understand the universal quantifier: \[ \forall x \in S, P(x) \] means \( P(x) \) is true for all elements \( x \) in \( S \).
Understand the existential quantifier: \[ \exists x \in S, P(x) \] means there exists at least one \( x \) in \( S \) for which \( P(x) \) is true.

Learn how to negate quantified statements: \[ 
eg ( orall x, P(x)) = \exists x, 
eg P(x) \], \[ 
eg (\exists x, P(x)) =  orall x, 
eg P(x) \].

cards.title: Relations, Functions, and Cardinality
cards.description: Understanding how sets interact through relations and mappings.
bulletpoints: Define a relation \( R \) on a set \( A \) as a subset of \( A \times A \), meaning \( R \subseteq A \times A \).
Explore properties of relations: reflexive (\( \forall x, (x,x) \in R \)), symmetric (\( xRy \Rightarrow yRx \)), transitive (\( xRy \text{ and } yRz \Rightarrow xRz \)).
Analyze function properties: injective (one-to-one, \( f(a) = f(b) \Rightarrow a = b \)), surjective (onto, \( \forall y, \exists x, f(x) = y \)), bijective (both injective and surjective).

cards.title: Power Sets & Cartesian Products
cards.description: Understanding how to construct sets of sets and cross-product structures.
bulletpoints: Define the power set \( \mathcal{P}(A) \) as the set of all subsets of \( A \), with cardinality \( |\mathcal{P}(A)| = 2^{|A|} \).
Construct Cartesian products: \[ A \times B = \{ (a, b) \mid a \in A, b \in B \} \].
Use power sets to analyze Boolean algebras and combinatorial structures.

cards.title: Axioms of Set Theory & Zermelo-Fraenkel (ZF) System
cards.description: Exploring formal axiomatic foundations of set theory.
bulletpoints: Study the axiom of extensionality: \[ \forall A, B, (\forall x, x \in A \iff x \in B) \Rightarrow A = B \].
Understand the axiom of infinity: \[ \exists S, (\emptyset \in S) \land (\forall x \in S, x \cup \{x\} \in S) \].
Explore the axiom of choice (AC) and its implications for proving cardinality results.

cards.title: Transfinite Numbers & Ordinal Hierarchies
cards.description: Exploring infinite cardinalities and well-ordered sets.
bulletpoints: Define the cardinality of a set \( |A| \) and its comparison using injections, surjections, and bijections.
Study infinite cardinal numbers: \( \aleph_0 \) (countable infinity), \( 2^{\aleph_0} \) (continuum cardinality).
Understand ordinal numbers \( \omega \), \( \omega+1 \), and transfinite induction.

cards.title: Boolean Algebra & Set Logic
cards.description: Understanding the logical algebra of sets and its applications in computation.
bulletpoints: Define Boolean operations: \[ A \cap B, A \cup B, A^c \].
Use distributive laws: \[ A \cap (B \cup C) = (A \cap B) \cup (A \cap C) \].
Analyze applications in circuit design and propositional logic.

cards.title: Set Theory Paradoxes & Logical Limits
cards.description: Exploring famous paradoxes that challenge set theory foundations.
bulletpoints: Study Russell’s paradox: \[ R = \{ x \mid x \notin x \} \Rightarrow R \in R \text{ or } R \notin R \].
Understand Cantor’s diagonal argument proving \( |\mathbb{R}| > |\mathbb{N}| \).
Explore Gödel’s incompleteness theorems and their impact on set logic.

cards.title: Quantifier Expressions & Nested Statements
cards.description: Mastering the use of multiple quantifiers in formal logic.
bulletpoints: Interpret nested quantifiers: \[ \forall x \exists y, P(x, y) \] vs. \[ \exists y \forall x, P(x, y) \].
Negate complex quantified statements using De Morgan’s rules.
Translate natural language statements into precise logical forms.

cards.title: Combinatorial Set Theory & Applications
cards.description: Exploring finite and infinite combinatorial structures within set theory.
bulletpoints: Understand Ramsey theory: \[ R(k,l) \] minimum conditions for monochromatic subsets.
Study partition relations and their role in large cardinal theory.
Apply combinatorial set techniques to probability and decision theory.
